==Highways== [[Image:Rodovias Duplicadas do Brasil, Junho de 2019.jpg|thumb|right|250px|
Road system in Brazil, with [[Dual carriageway|divided highways]] highlighted in red. The [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo state]], which has state control of most federal roads in its territory, made its road network the most extensive one in the country, thanks to this fact.
]] ''{{Main|Brazilian Highway System}}'' Brazil has 1,751,868 kilometers of roads, 96,353 km of them paved and 1,655,515 km unpaved. That means that only 5.5% of the roads are paved and that 94.5% are unpaved. The most important highway of the country is [[BR-116]] and the second is [[BR-101]]. [[Image:Rodovia dos Imigrantes 1.jpg|thumb|[[Rodovia dos Imigrantes]]]] The country has a low rate of car ownership of 140 per 1000 people, however in comparison to the other developing economies of International Airport]].]] Most international flights must go to [[São Paulo–Guarulhos International Airport]] or [[Rio de Janeiro–Galeão International Airport]]. Belo Horizonte is the main international airport outside Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo. A few go to Brasília, Recife, Natal, and just recently Fortaleza has accepted international flights. With South American integration, more airports can be expected to open to international flights.
